author: garyrong
content: Yes

author: garyrong
content: But I would appreciate if you guys can also make the similar simulation, as we use different types of database and the results may be slightly different

author: matkt0
content: it's something we want test but maybe not in the coming weeks

author: lukaszrozmej
content: Have we looked into how BAL's compress? Would they compress better if sorted by Address?

author: nero_eth
content:
Compression efficiency with Snappy is at around ~65% but having many addresses (e.g. stablecoins, defi pools, etc) being accesses in multiple transaction allows for nice deduplication. 
Also, it may be handy in the future for partial stateless nodes that only follow the state diffs of specific accounts.

author: fradamt
content:
> Besides, the concurrent read performance saturates around 32 threads, showing no significant gains with higher concurrency. This indicates that the BAL with read locations can provide noticeable benefits before the network's block gas limit increases to 512 Mgas.

Is it worth adding storage reads if we think they won't be useful as the min number of txs per block increases to >= 32?

content:

Location: Zoom (livestreamed on YouTube)

Agenda:
* Clarify CREATE and CREATE2 handling (since last breakout)
* Spec changes & proposed changes:
* Client and devnet updates

author: garyrong
content:
it's an interesting topic. I think we need to re-evaluate the read performance at that time. 

With the 512 Mgas block, we can achieve that we at least have 32 txs. However, as we gradually raise the gas limit, the eventual state size remains uncertain.

author: garyrong
content: However, in general, the benefits gained from bal-reads will decrease as the gas limit increases.

author: nero_eth
content:
Another potentially interesting experiment would be re-running Gary's benchmarks on a state of 2x (or more) the size of today (288 GiB -> 576 GiB).
cc <@353136597522448385> <@703742742135570499>

author: raxhvl
content: Erigon hive integration

author: matkt0
content: just thinking that if we have a transaction with a lot of SLOAD. Itâ€™s different than having a transaction with a lot of SSTORE. Because if you have a lot of SSTORE you will have more intermediate nodes to read in the state root computation step+the read of the gast cost . So if we do state root background computation at the same time as we do batch reading it will increase the amount of IO. One SLOAD is only one read with a flat db but one write can be more as you need to climb the trie. So what is the wort case a block full of SLOAD or full of SSTORE ?

author: garyrong
content: but sload is 10 times cheaper than sstore

author: qu0b
content:
Following up on the call I've added a debug endpoints section <https://notes.ethereum.org/@ethpandaops/bal-devnet-0#Debug-Endpoints>

It would be great if all clients could provide a debug endpoint with at least their generated BAL.

author: garyrong
content:
with all sstore, we can indeed prefetch the intermediate nodes at the background, in this case read-list is not useful;

but with all sload, we still have to tackle this heavy block

author: garyrong
content: we need to make sure bal can be beneficial for all scenarios

author: matkt0
content:
So, in a situation where we have one transaction with a lot of SLOAD operations, while other transactions are not doing much SLOAD, the read operation can still be useful. For this scenario, we should keep it.  

The gas_used could also be helpful here. If we detect only one or two transactions using too much gas, we could start batch reading, because thereâ€™s a higher chance we are in this kind of scenario. However, if the gas_used is more evenly distributed across transactions, maybe we donâ€™t need to start batch reading. Iâ€™m just thinking out loud

author: garyrong
content: For clarification, I think the ultimate goal of BAL is to push the network gas limit safely. Itâ€™s why I say BAL should be beneficial across different scenarios, otherwise the worst case can be exploited

author: matkt0
content: Yes I agree what I'm saying is we should maybe use the info we have in bal in a different way regarding the kind of block we have. So I'm saying having the read in BAL but no use them everytime
